newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Qantas shares catch profit updraft.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Qantas shares catch profit updraft.

text.p: The shares of Australia's flag carrier Qantas Airways Ltd rose strongly to a record high on Friday after the company posted a half year profit towards the upper end of market expectations on Thursday.
At 11.10 a.m (0010 GMT) Qantas stock was six cents or 2.44 percent higher at A$2.52 on turnover on 2.06 million shares.

"The market has a preoccupation with buying service stocks at the moment. The result was evidence Qantas has managed to cut its costs and record a solid result when other international airlines are struggling," a Sydney-based dealer said.

Qantas, 25 percent owned by British Airways Plc, reported a net profit of A$151.6 million for the six months ended December 31, a result towards the higher end of market expectations which ranged from A$116 million to A$154 million.
The airline said its first half profit growth was largely attributable to a cost cutting programme which was aimed to offset the anticipated slowdown in the rate of revenue growth.
Qantas said cost savings of A$237 million had been made in the half year, and full year cost savings were expected to exceed the airline's target of A$430 million.
